main event: A UFO sighting was reported on 11th September 1957 in Aiken, South Carolina, involving a bright white light that changed color and appeared to make rapid movements before moving rapidly to the northeast. The conclusion was that it was probably a balloon.
interesting points: The object was observed hovering at a low altitude and making darting movements, at times appearing to become elongated.
It changed color from bright white to red with a blue streak, resembling a balloon.
The observation lasted for 5-10 minutes and the object was circular in appearance.
The report noted glow with whitish streaks, thought to be possibly a balloon.
The observation took place at night with clear conditions during the first sighting and high broken clouds during the second sighting.
sighted object: bright light changing to red with a blue streak
witnesses: instrument mechanic at the Savannah River Project
